0.title: Which are the highest revenue-generating football clubs as per Deloitte Money League?
0.article_body: Manchester City have topped the Deloitte Football Money League for the first time as the world's highest revenue-generating club in 2020-21 season. Manchester City topped the list with €644.9-million revenue. They were followed by Real Madrid (€640.7 million) and Bayern Munich (€611.4 million). Barcelona dropped three places to be ranked fourth on the list with €582.1-million revenue.

1.title: Russian Grandmaster Sergey Karjakin banned for 6 months over pro-Russia comments
1.article_body: Russian Grandmaster Sergey Karjakin has been banned from competition for six months by the International Chess Federation (FIDE) over his pro-Russia comments amid war with Ukraine. After being banned, Karjakin, who represented Ukraine before adopting Russian citizenship in 2009, said, "First...I am a patriot of my country and only second of all I am an athlete. I don't regret anything."

2.title: Why is temperature above normal in March this year?
2.article_body: With several states/UTs recording above normal temperature in March this year, IMD's Director General Mrutyunjay Mohapatra said one of the reason could be that there were no active western disturbances, which bring colder winds. The lack of pre-monsoon showers has contributed to the overall heating. Hot winds from deserts of northwest India contribute to soaring temperatures in central regions.

3.title: Plane crash with 132 on board is China's 1st fatal accident in 12 years
3.article_body: With 132 people on board, the plane crash that took place on Monday is the first fatal accident in China in 12 years. China's last plane crash was in 2010 when an Embraer E-190 regional jet flown by Henan Airlines crashed due to low visibility, killing 44 of 96 people on board. No survivors have been found from Monday's crash.

4.title: Suzuki, SkyDrive partner to develop, market electric aircraft
4.article_body: Japan's Suzuki Motor has signed a deal with SkyDrive to partner up for research, development and marketing of electric, vertical takeoff and landing aircraft. The firms said they will also work to open up new markets with an initial focus on India. SkyDrive is currently focussing on development of a compact, two-seating electric-powered flying car with plans for full-scale production.

5.title: RSS is similar to Jinnah, both divide people: Assam AIUDF MLA
5.article_body: An All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) MLA from Assam, Rafiqul Islam, has equated RSS to Pakistan's founder Muhammad Ali Jinnah. "Jinnah divided the country into two parts - India and Pakistan...BJP and RSS are also doing the same thing, and they are dividing Hindu and Muslim, Dalits and non-Dalits," the MLA from Jania constituency said.

6.title: Heat in Gurugram likely to rise, temp to cross 41°C by end of this week
6.article_body: IMD has predicted the maximum temperature in Gurugram is likely to touch 41°C by the end of this week. It said the maximum temperature in the city is likely to increase by five degrees and hover around 41°C by Saturday. Gurugram recorded a maximum temperature of 37.8°C on Sunday, the highest temperature the city has seen so far this year.

7.title: Wallets, ID cards of people presumed dead in China plane crash found
7.article_body: Wallets, bank cards and official identity cards, that belonged to the 132 people presumed dead in the China Eastern Airlines crash, were found on a mountainside on Tuesday. The items were lined up by rescue workers scouring the mountainside. The Boeing 737 aircraft, travelling from Kunming to Guangzhou on Monday, is believed to have 'nosedived' before crashing in the mountains.

8.title: Adil criticised over his tweet on 'The Kashmir…', actor says it was 'ill-timed'
8.article_body: Adil Hussain was criticised for his tweet on 'The Kashmir Files', where he shared his views on the film and tweeted, "Truth must be spoken but tenderly or else truth loses its beauty". Reacting to it, a user wrote, "If you're Muslim then no matter what you'll support Terrorism." Later, Adil apologised and called it "the most ill-timed tweet ever".

9.title: Shiv Sena will always remain a Hindutva party: Sanjay Raut
9.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that his party was a "Hindutva party" and will always remain the same. "The question of political ideology should be asked to BJP when they formed government with Mehbooba Mufti in Kashmir, where did their political ideology go?" he added. Earlier, Raut had said that BJP is doing politics on a sensitive issue like Kashmir.

10.title: Bill to merge 3 municipal corporations of Delhi cleared by Cabinet
10.article_body: The Union Cabinet on Tuesday cleared the Delhi Municipal Corporation Amendment Act 2022, for the unification of all three municipal corporations of Delhi. Reportedly, the bill will be tabled in the Parliament next week. Earlier, State Election Commission delayed the MCD polls after receiving communication regarding the unification. Subsequently, AAP criticised the Centre for pressurising SEC.

11.title: Delhi govt to build Shaheed Bhagat Singh Armed Forces Preparatory School
11.article_body: Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday announced that the Delhi government will build Shaheed Bhagat Singh Armed Forces Preparatory School. The school, where students will be trained for the armed forces, will be built on 14 acres of land in Jharoda Kalan, he added. "The fees for the school will be free...will have separate hostels for boys and girls," Kejriwal stated.

12.title: Opposition walks out of Lok Sabha over fuel, cooking gas price hike
12.article_body: Members of the opposition parties staged a protest in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday against the rise in prices of petrol, diesel and domestic cooking gas. They then staged a walkout demanding a rollback. Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked by 80 paise a litre and domestic cooking gas prices have been increased by ₹50 per cylinder.

13.title: I've been out of work for 3yrs, people lost faith in me: Bobby Deol
13.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol has stated that he has seen his lows and was out of work for almost three years. "It's not that people didn't want to work with me, it's just that they lost faith in me," he added. Bobby further said it's a fight to find good work, adding that people who perform well keep getting good work.

14.title: OYO to offer free accommodation to Ukrainian refugees
14.article_body: OYO said it'll offer free accommodation to refugees fleeing from Ukraine. Starting with Poland, efforts are being undertaken to appeal to over 600 of OYO's Belvilla homeowners to open their holiday homes to refugees, the company said. OYO said it has also started a campaign to collect funds to help homeowners who agree to provide free accommodation to refugees.

15.title: Japan issues blackout alert, urges people to save electricity
15.article_body: Japan on Tuesday sounded a blackout alert after operations at several power plants halted owing to the recent earthquake. The Tokyo Electric Power Company has warned that 20-30 lakh households could lose power soon at the current power usage rate. The government has urged citizens, businesses and local authorities to minimise electricity usage.

16.title: Man escapes Pune lockup through gap between 2 iron rods, arrested within 2 hrs
16.article_body: A 19-year-old man was rearrested after he escaped through a gap between two iron rods of the door of a Pune police station lockup. While the man was arrested within two hours of his escape, a police official said that he took advantage of his slim physique and an extra rod will be added to cover the gap.

17.title: Russia's attempt to capture Kyiv is suicide: Ukrainian official
17.article_body: Ukrainian presidential adviser Oleksiy Arestovych on Tuesday said that one of Russia's main priorities is to take control of Ukraine's capital Kyiv but trying to do so is "suicide". He also said that active hostilities between Ukraine and Russia could end within 2-3 weeks. Russian and Ukrainian officials have held several rounds of talks since the start of the conflict.

18.title: I was surprised that Yashasvi Jaiswal was retained by RR: Jaffer
18.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said he was surprised when 20-year-old Yashasvi Jaiswal was retained by RR along with Sanju Samson and Jos Buttler. "When you are a retained player, there is a different responsibility...how [Yashasvi] handles the pressure will be interesting to see," he added. Yashasvi scored 249 runs in 10 matches last IPL season.

19.title: Mali’s ex-Prime Minister Soumeylou Maiga dies in detention
19.article_body: Mali's former PM Soumeylou Maiga, arrested over corruption allegations last year, has died due to an undisclosed illness, one of his lawyers said. The 67-year-old died at a clinic in Bamako on Monday, where he'd been hospitalised since December, the lawyer added. Reportedly, the military government had refused his family's request to allow Maiga to travel abroad for treatment.

20.title: 96-year-old World War II Holocaust survivor killed in shelling in Ukraine
20.article_body: A 96-year-old Holocaust survivor, Boris Romanchenko, was killed in Russian shelling in Ukraine. Buchenwald memorial institute said that Romanchenko had survived the Nazi camps at Buchenwald, Peenemunde, Dora and Bergen-Belsen during World War II. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Please think about how many things he has come through but he was killed by a Russian strike."

21.title: Let's see how Umran performs with pressure of expectations in IPL: Jaffer
21.article_body: Talking about Umran Malik, who was retained by SRH for ₹4 crore before IPL mega auction 2022,  Wasim Jaffer said it remains to be seen how the 22-year-old pacer performs with pressure of expectations in upcoming IPL. "He's somebody who bowls 150 clicks (kmph)," he added. Umran made his IPL debut last season and took two wickets from three matches.

22.title: Man stalks woman, claims she is a sex worker; arrested in Mumbai
22.article_body: A 58-year-old man, Venu Koli, has been arrested for allegedly stalking and sexually harassing a 38-year-old woman in south Mumbai. The victim said Koli had uploaded a message on his Whatsapp status, claiming that she was a sex worker. She alleged that he got CCTV cameras installed in her residential area and would upload her videos on platforms like YouTube.

23.title: 2 women rescued as Noida Police bust online sex racket; 1 arrested
23.article_body: Noida Police have rescued two women and arrested one person as they busted a sex racket that was being run through online booking, an official said. During interrogation, the accused revealed he used to send women to different houses and hotels after contacting his customers through the internet and WhatsApp. He collected huge amounts of money from the customers daily.

24.title: Rahul Mahajan's ex-wife Dimpy Ganguly announces third pregnancy, shares pic
24.article_body: Rahul Mahajan's ex-wife, model Dimpy Ganguly, announced her third pregnancy. Taking to Instagram, Dimpy shared a photo flaunting her baby bump, in which her two kids can also be seen by her side. She captioned the post, "The most...fulfilling love I've ever experienced is the love I have received from my babies...Can't believe very soon this love will become x3!"

25.title: The Fame Game's Gagan Arora marries longtime girlfriend, shares pics
25.article_body: Actor Gagan Arora, who portrayed Madhav in 'The Fame Game', has announced that he married longtime girlfriend Muditaa last month. Gagan shared pictures from the wedding, writing, "With a lot of restrictions and a very small gathering...we started this new journey." He further wrote that 12 years ago, he looked at Muditaa and told his friends he will marry her.

26.title: We did well to get to 229 after losing 3 wickets in 5 balls vs B'desh: Mithali
26.article_body: After defeating Bangladesh by 110 runs in the Women's ODI World Cup, India captain Mithali Raj said they did well to post the 229-run total despite losing the first three wickets in five balls during their innings. "Having all-rounders definitely gives the cushion of batting deep," she added. India have now won three of their six games in the tournament.

27.title: New batteries for Delhi remote control: Sidhu on AAP's RS nominee choices
27.article_body: Taking a jibe at Aam Aadmi Party's Rajya Sabha nominee choices, Congress leader Navjot Sidhu said, "New batteries for the Delhi remote control, it's blinking... Harbhajan is an exception, the rest are batteries and betrayal of Punjab." Earlier, the AAP party rivals had claimed that Arvind Kejriwal intends to "control" the new Punjab government from the national capital.

28.title: B'luru man slits wife's throat in front of kids, then dies by suicide
28.article_body: Sampath, a 36-year-old factory worker, slit his wife's throat in front of their children and later died by suicide on Monday morning in Bengaluru's Attibele. According to police, the couple got into a fight and Sampath later slit his wife's throat while she was sleeping. He also stabbed one of their minor sons as he moved to help the victim.

29.title: 125-yr-old Padma awardee Swami Sivananda eats oil-free food, wakes up at 3 am
29.article_body: Yoga guru Swami Sivananda who received Padma Shri on Monday had revealed earlier that he eats food that is free of oil and spices and prefers eating rice and boiled daal with some green chillies. The 125-year-old wakes up at 3 am and follows a rigorous daily routine. A video of him kneeling before PM Narendra Modi had gone viral.

30.title: Will run govt transparently, make U'khand best state of India: Dhami
30.article_body: Uttarakhand CM-designate Pushkar Singh Dhami said on Tuesday that he'll ensure his administration's work reaches people at the grassroots. "We will run our government in complete transparency and make Uttarakhand the best out of all the states in the country," Dhami added. Dhami, who lost from Khatima Assembly constituency, will take oath as CM for a second term on Wednesday.

31.title: Son no longer named Wolf, we didn't feel like it was him: Kylie Jenner
31.article_body: American reality television personality Kylie Jenner took to Instagram Stories to announce that her son is no longer named Wolf. She wrote, "We just really didn't feel like it was him. Just wanted to share because I keep seeing Wolf everywhere." Her announcement came hours after she shared a YouTube video showing intimate footage leading up to her son's birth.

32.title: Pradeep an inspiration, firmly placed in millions of Indians' hearts: Smriti
32.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani took to Instagram to share post for Pradeep Mehra, a 19-year-old youth, who was spotted running on roads of Noida in a bid to prepare for joining the Indian Army. "Pradeep...a hero...hopeful for a place in the Indian Army now firmly placed in the heart of millions of Indians...an inspiration," read the post by Smriti Irani.

33.title: Faf Du Plessis commands a lot of respect, doesn't demand it: Kohli
33.article_body: Talking about new RCB captain Faf Du Plessis, former RCB captain Virat Kohli said, "Du Plessis commands a lot of respect, does not demand it because he has been there and done that." "I messaged him as soon as he was picked for RCB. It was official after, but I knew obviously," added Kohli.

34.title: To carry the hopes of billions for years was sensational: Lara on Tendulkar
34.article_body: Talking about Sachin Tendulkar, Brian Lara said, "To carry the hopes of billions for...years was sensational. We have always kept in touch, there is mutual respect. What I like the most...is his humility." Lara termed late Australian cricketer Shane Warne as the greatest leg-spinner ever. "Facing him was a challenge. We have been involved in some fascinating duels," added Lara.

35.title: Russia bars its scientists from international conferences
35.article_body: Russian scientists will not participate in international conferences this year, Russia's Ministry of Science and Higher Education said. "We are not calling for abandoning publications in Web of Science and Scopus (academic resources)," Minister Valery Falkov said in a statement. "We need to act in accordance with our national interests," he added.

36.title: ED questions TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee in coal scam case for 8 hrs in Delhi
36.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday questioned TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee at its New Delhi office for nearly eight hours in connection with the coal scam case. Banerjee reached the Central agency's office at around 11 am yesterday and left shortly before 8 pm. He was accompanied by his security personnel and legal team.

37.title: 2 women among 10 arrested for attacking police during Holi in Karnal
37.article_body: At least 10 persons, including two women, were arrested by the Karnal police for allegedly damaging a police vehicle, injuring three police officials and creating ruckus in a government hospital after a clash over Holi celebrations in Karnal. The incident took place during a clash between the two groups during Holi celebrations.

38.title: Doctors told to remove genitals of captured Russians in Ukraine
38.article_body: The owner of a war-zone mobile hospital in Ukraine has instructed his doctors to remove genitals of captured Russian soldiers. "I have always been a great humanist...But now [I gave] very strict orders to castrate all [captured Russian] men, because they are cockroaches, not people," the 49-year-old owner said. Since 2014, around 500 doctors have worked with his mobile hospital.

39.title: Which were the most polluted cities in India and Pakistan in 2021?
39.article_body: India was home to 11 of the 15 most polluted cities in Central and South Asia in 2021, with the remaining four cities being from Pakistan, as per World Air Quality Report. Bhiwadi was the most polluted city in India, followed by Ghaziabad, Delhi and Jaunpur. Faisalabad was the most polluted city in Pakistan, followed by Bahawalpur, Peshawar and Lahore.

40.title: Please stop bothering Pradeep Mehra for interviews: Kapri requests media outlets
40.article_body: Filmmaker Vinod Kapri on Monday requested media organisations to stop bothering 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra for interviews. Kapri's initial video of Mehra running in Noida at midnight had been widely circulated on social media and received reactions from various celebrities. "You can use my videos without permission...Just let that kid live his life. Stop this spectacle," Kapri added.

41.title: HUL in talks to buy majority stake in MDH at ₹10,000 crore-₹15,000 crore valuation: Report
41.article_body: FMCG major Hindustan Unilever Ltd is in discussions to buy a majority stake in MDH Spices, Livemint reported on Tuesday. MDH could be valued between ₹10,000 crore and ₹15,000 crore, the report added. MDH Spices is said to have been in discussions with other conglomerates too after the demise of Founder Mahashay Dharampal Gulati, who passed away in December 2020.

42.title: It will shake you to core, I cried in 1st meeting: Vipul on 'The Kerala Story'
42.article_body: Sunshine Pictures has announced the movie 'The Kerala Story' based on "true stories of about 32,000 girls and counting". "This story is a human tragedy, one that will shake you to the core. When Sudipto came and narrated it...along with his research of over 3-4 years, I was in tears in the first meeting itself," producer Vipul Shah said.

43.title: Have high hopes for Sarfaraz Khan this time: Wasim Jaffer
43.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said he has high hopes for Sarfaraz Khan, who was bought by DC for ₹20 lakh. "Sarfaraz has played at number five, six and seven mostly...this year we might get to see him bat at three or four," Jaffer explained. Sarfaraz has scored a total of 33 runs in the last two IPL seasons.

44.title: Russian court finds Putin critic Navalny guilty of fraud
44.article_body: A Russian court on Tuesday found President Vladimir Putin's jailed critic Alexey Navalny guilty of fraud and embezzlement charges. Russian prosecutors are seeking to move Navalny to a maximum security prison for 13 years. Navalny called the charges against him "politically motivated". He is currently serving a two-and-a-half-year sentence at a prison camp in Moscow for parole violations.

45.title: Pushkar Singh Dhami to take oath as U'khand CM for 2nd time tomorrow
45.article_body: Uttarakhand CM-designate Pushkar Singh Dhami will take oath as the Chief Minister for the second time in Dehradun on Wednesday. The ceremony will be held at 3.30 pm at the Parade Ground. Dhami, who lost from the Khatima seat in the Assembly polls, was elected leader of the BJP legislature party in Uttarakhand on Monday.

46.title: Over 5,000 planets exist beyond our solar system, confirms NASA
46.article_body: NASA confirmed that more than 5,000 planets exist beyond our solar system, representing a 30-year journey of discovery led by NASA space telescopes. The number of confirmed exoplanets crossed the 5,000-mark on March 21, with the latest batch of 65 exoplanets – planets outside our immediate solar family. The 5,000-plus planets found so far include small, rocky worlds like Earth.

47.title: No plans to make Tripura dry state, no proof that prohibition works: Govt
47.article_body: There are no plans to make Tripura a dry state, said Deputy Chief Minister Jishnu Dev Varma on Monday. "There is no scientific evidence that substantiates the claim that a ban on alcohol sales would reduce consumption," he added. The minister said the government is acting against illegal brewers, dealers and stockists of alcohol across the state.

48.title: Ranveer, Jacqueline are class apart when it comes to dancing: Govinda
48.article_body: In a recent interview, when asked who would be perfect to take his and actress Karisma Kapoor's place as a hit on-screen Jodi, actor Govinda replied, "I think today, from the younger crop, Ranveer Singh and Jacqueline Fernandez are both a class apart when it comes to dancing." "I think they would make a great Jodi as well," he added.

49.title: CM Yogi resigns as MLC ahead of oath-taking ceremony on March 25
49.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has tendered his resignation from the UP Legislative Council days after getting elected as an MLA from the Gorakhpur Urban constituency. CM Yogi was elected to the UP Legislative Council soon after becoming the state's CM in 2017. The 49-year-old politician is likely to take oath as CM again during the ceremony on March 25.

50.title: Police officer injured after car hits him in Hyd; video surfaces
50.article_body: A police officer was injured after a BMW car knocked him down on Hyderabad's Tank Bund on Monday. A video of the incident has surfaced online. A police inspector told Telangana Today that the police officer was crossing the road to check something when the car hit him, following which he fell on the car and then on the road.

51.title: Tesla to hand over 1st Model Ys made at its German Gigafactory
51.article_body: Tesla will hand over the first Model Y vehicles made at its German Gigafactory plant to clients on Tuesday. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz will attend Tuesday's ceremony alongside Tesla Chief Executive Elon Musk. "Excited to hand over the first production cars made by Giga Berlin-Brandenburg," Musk said on Twitter. Tesla plans to hire 12,000 workers for the plant.

52.title: Akhilesh quits as Lok Sabha MP after winning 1st Assembly poll
52.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh CM and Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav has resigned as Lok Sabha MP, days after he won his first Assembly poll from Karhal in UP. He had won from Azamgarh Lok Sabha constituency in the 2019 election. With 1,48,196 votes, he defeated his closest rival from BJP, Prof SP Singh Baghel, in Karhal.

53.title: Ex-ABVP chief who urinated in front of woman's home granted bail
53.article_body: Madras High Court on Monday granted interim bail to former ABVP National President Dr Subbiah Shanmugam for allegedly harassing a 62-year-old woman by urinating in front of her house and throwing surgical masks in 2020. The court did so saying that Subbiah was arrested on a public holiday and questioned why the arrest happened "1.5 years after complaint was filed".

54.title: 6 arrested for performing bike stunts on Chennai's Kamarajar Salai
54.article_body: Police have arrested six men who performed dangerous motorcycle stunts on Kamarajar Salai near Marina Beach in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. Expensive motorbikes, including those from brands KTM, Yamaha and Activa, have been seized from the bikers. Police said it is illegal to modify bikes and mechanics have been directed to inform police if youngsters ask them to modify their two-wheelers.

55.title: Tiger electrocuted in trap laid for wild boars in MP, 4 arrested
55.article_body: A tiger was electrocuted in a trap laid for wild boars in Balaghat district of Madhya Pradesh, a forest official said on Tuesday. The tiger, about 10 to 12 years old, was found buried under the sand in a forest area near Ratta village, Narendra Sanodia, chief conservator of forest, said. Four people were arrested in connection with the killing.

56.title: Issues of Kashmiri Pandits never came in newspapers: Brahmin group member
56.article_body: BK Premananda Kamath from Kerala, who is a member of the Gaud Saraswat Brahmin community, said 'The Kashmir Files' is a "heart-wrenching" movie. "I remember these issues had never come in the newspapers, except saying that one Hindu was killed and a Pandit was killed...We never knew that so many atrocities had happened to the Hindus back then," he added.

57.title: RR have fantastic attack and I'm here to guide them to deliver their best: Malinga
57.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka pacer Lasith Malinga, who has been roped by RR as their fast bowling coach, has said the franchise has a fantastic pace attack and he's there to guide the pacers to deliver their best. "[It's a] talented group of bowlers...we've got experienced overseas players like Boult and Coulter-Nile...genuine Indian fast bowlers in Prasidh and Saini," Malinga added.

58.title: T'gana BJP MP slams CM KCR for politicising paddy procurement
58.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao demanded that the Centre buy the entire paddy crop produced in the state, BJP MP D Arvind slammed the former for politicising paddy procurement. "The TRS government has to give around 5,00,000 tonnes of paddy to the Centre, but they're not doing that...instead, Telangana government is black marketing it," the Nizamabad MP added.

59.title: 10 dead as mob sets houses on fire in WB's Birbhum after TMC leader's murder
59.article_body: At least 10 people died after a mob allegedly set 10-12 houses on fire in West Bengal's Birbhum on Monday, fire officials said. "A total of 10 dead bodies have been recovered...seven bodies...retrieved from a single house," officials added. This comes after a TMC panchayat leader of Barshal village in Birbhum, Bhadu Sheikh, was killed in an alleged bomb attack.

60.title: Will be a big call by KKR to bowl Varun in death overs: Irfan Pathan
60.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said, "I think KKR can [sort their death bowling]...by adding a couple of overs of Varun Chakaravarthy. It's...a big call." KKR had economy rates of 9.24 runs per over and 8.28 runs per over respectively in the Indian and UAE leg of IPL 2021. Shreyas Iyer will lead KKR in IPL 2022.

61.title: Lockdown imposed on fuel prices lifted: Rahul Gandhi mocks PM Modi
61.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi-led government over hike in fuel prices. "The lockdown imposed on gas, diesel and petrol prices has been lifted. The government will now regularly do 'vikas' (development) in prices," tweeted Gandhi. "If PM is questioned about the inflation epidemic, he would say 'Thali Bajao' (bang plates)," he added.

62.title: Chennai civic body proposes to cancel licenses of shops violating plastic ban
62.article_body: The Chennai civic body is planning to cancel licences of shops and other establishments, which continue to sell banned plastic items in the city. The proposal comes in response to a writ petition from Tamil Nadu and Puducherry Plastic Manufacturers Association, challenging the state government's order, banning production and sale of 14 types of plastic items from January 1, 2019.

63.title: Sri Lanka sends troops to oversee fuel distribution amid economic crisis
63.article_body: Sri Lanka ordered its military to post soldiers at hundreds of gas stations to help distribute fuel amid a widespread shortage caused by the economic crisis in the country. "At least two...personnel will be deployed at every fuel pump," a military spokesman Nilantha Premaratne said. This comes after three people collapsed and died while waiting in queues to buy fuel.

64.title: They believe it's real me: Sudhanshu on his misogynistic character in Anupamaa
64.article_body: Speaking about his "misogynist" character in 'Anupamaa', actor Sudhanshu Pandey said he has been subjected to unending criticism for what 'Vanraj' does on the show. He added, "It was new to me because I wasn't part of the television industry." "They start believing...what I play on show is the real me...I had to bear the trolling...on social media," he said.

65.title: AAP's Sanjay Singh asks party workers to prepare for UP civic polls
65.article_body: AAP on Sunday decided to contest the forthcoming civic polls in UP and also make changes in the party's organisational structure. Presiding over a two-day meeting of AAP state executive, the party's state in-charge Sanjay Singh told party workers to start preparing for the UP civic polls. Singh stated that AAP had emerged as an alternative to other national parties.

66.title: There will be daily 'vikas' in petrol & diesel prices: Mallikarjun Kharge
66.article_body: Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge said that by increasing fuel prices the PM Modi-led government is making money worth ₹10,000 crores by plundering the poor. Taking to Twitter, he said, "Congratulations to PM Modiji for achieving his 'target' of ₹1,000 per LPG cylinder...There will now be daily 'vikas' in petrol and diesel prices as well."

67.title: Sadhguru begins 30,000-km bike tour from London to India for 'Save Soil' campaign
67.article_body: Yoga guru Jaggi Vasudev, also known as Sadhguru, on Monday began his 30,000-kilometre motorbike journey from London to India as part of his 'Save Soil' awareness campaign. The 64-year-old's 100-day tour will take him across Europe and the Middle East, where he'll be meeting celebrities and environmentalists. "I'm not a scientist...but I know there's a soil crisis," he said earlier.

68.title: Read this before the outrage: Zomato CEO shares explainer on 10-minute delivery
68.article_body: After Zomato faced criticism for announcing a 10-minute food delivery service, CEO Deepinder Goyal clarified, "10-minute delivery is as safe for our delivery partners as 30-minute delivery." "Please take 2 minutes to read...this (before the outrage)," he wrote, sharing an explainer. It will only be for items that are standardised and can be dispatched within two minutes, the explainer said.

69.title: Which are the world's most polluted capitals according to World Air Quality Report 2021?
69.article_body: As per the World Air Quality Report 2021 by Swiss organisation IQAir, India's capital Delhi is the world's most polluted capital city with an average annual PM2.5 concentration of 96.4 µg/m3. Delhi is followed by Bangladesh's Dhaka, Chad's N'Djamena, Tajikistan's Dushanbe and Oman's Muscat. Delhi saw an annual increase of 14.6% in PM2.5 concentrations in 2021.

70.title: B'luru ACB conducts search on agents suspected of influencing govt officials
70.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) is conducting searches at locations of nine middlemen and agents suspected of influencing government officials in Bengaluru. The accused are suspected of being involved in malpractices and irregularities in the activities of the Bangalore Development Authority. About 100 officials are conducting the raids under supervision of Uma Prashant, Superintendent of Police.

71.title: India defeat Bangladesh by 110 runs, jump to 3rd on Women's World Cup points table
71.article_body: India defeated Bangladesh by 110 runs to register their third victory in the 2022 Women's World Cup. With the win, India have now jumped to the third spot on the points table. Yastika Bhatia was named Player of the Match for scoring 50(80). Earlier today, Australia handed South Africa their first defeat in 2022 Women's World Cup.

72.title: Makers planning to turn 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' into comic book series: Report
72.article_body: 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' makers are planning to turn film into comic book series, Free Press Journal quoted source as saying. "Aditya [Chopra] wants to immortalise character of Jayeshbhai Jordaar...first thing they are planning to do is turn Jayeshbhai into comic book series. They feel character will appeal to universal set of audience...Adi wants...character to get...popular with kids!" source said.

73.title: Jack Ma-led Alibaba increases share buyback size to record $25 bn
73.article_body: Billionaire Jack Ma-led Alibaba has increased its share buyback programme to $25 billion, the largest ever repurchase plan by the e-commerce firm. In August, Alibaba had increased the programme from $10 billion to $15 billion. The firm's board has approved the programme, which will run through March 2024. Alibaba's shares rose 4.8% in Hong Kong following the news.

74.title: 64-yr-old Kerala man gets 73 yrs in jail for molesting 7-yr-old grandson
74.article_body: A Kerala court sentenced a 64-year-old man to 73 years in jail for sexually abusing his seven-year-old grandson in 2019 and fined him ₹1,60,000. The incident came to light after the accused's wife witnessed the crime. The man was awarded 20 years in jail under three sections of POCSO, 10 years for repeated offence and three years under Section 377.

75.title: Two foreign institutes want to set up campuses in India: Govt
75.article_body: Two foreign education institutes, based out of Italy and France, are interested in setting up campuses in India, MoS for Education Subhas Sarkar told Parliament. Milan-based Istituto Marangoni expressed interest to establish a foreign, fully independent higher education institute of fashion and design while the French side wants to set up a university campus for higher education courses, he added.

76.title: Common entrance test for UG admissions in central universities, Class 12 marks won't count
76.article_body: All central universities will have to admit students to undergraduate courses based on the Common University Entrance Test (CUET) and not Class 12 marks, the University Grants Commission (UGC) said on Monday. This rule will come into force from the upcoming academic year 2022-23. The application window for the examination will open in the first week of April.

77.title: Akhilesh repeatedly said fuel prices will rise after polls: Jaya
77.article_body: After fuel prices were raised for the first time in over four months, SP MP Jaya Bachchan on Tuesday said, "This is how the government does." She added that party chief Akhilesh Yadav had "repeatedly" said that people should be alert as "price is going to increase after the elections". "Don't know who brought [BJP] to power," she further said.

78.title: AAP names office-bearers for 9 states, aims to 'expand footprint'
78.article_body: AAP has announced office-bearers for nine states including Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh where elections are due later this year. AAP released the names by posting, "We are all set to increase our footprint throughout India!" AAP's Rajya Sabha nominee Sandeep Pathak has been appointed as incharge of Gujarat and also, he will be replacing Raghav Chadha as co-incharge of Punjab.

79.title: Video shows pre-school kids chant 'We want Biden out' slogans in US
79.article_body: A video has surfaced showing a teacher leading pre-school children in sloganeering against US President Joe Biden. "Who's our president?" asks the teacher and the children say, "Biden". "What do we want to do with him?" the teacher asks next, to which the children respond, "We want him out!" The California-based school later issued an apology to the parents.

80.title: Didn't know much about Kashmiri Pandits; I feel ashamed of myself: Darshan
80.article_body: Actor Darshan Kumar, who starred in 'The Kashmir Files' said he didn't know much about the Kashmiri Pandits. He added, "I really feel ashamed of myself. Just like today's audience I too was confused and unaware." "I only realised when Vivek Agnihotri and Pallavi Joshi showed me those videos of the first-generation victims. I was totally taken aback," he said.

81.title: Mumbai Police arrests 36 drunk drivers, 115 wrong-side drivers on Holi
81.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police arrested 36 drunk drivers and 115 motorists for driving on the wrong side and penalised 8,276 drivers for various other violations across the city during Holi on Friday. The police officials were unable to use breath analysers due to COVID restrictions and thus they collected blood samples of the drivers which were sent for forensic tests.

82.title: Chiranjeevi, Salman's pic from Godfather sets surfaces, fan says 'Megastars'
82.article_body: Actor Salman Khan has begun shooting for the Telugu film 'Godfather', which is headlined by South actor Chiranjeevi. Recently, a picture from the sets of Godfather has surfaced on Twitter. In the photo, Chiranjeevi and Salman can be seen posing with the director and producers on the set. Commenting on the post, one of the fans wrote, "Two megastars."

83.title: Ukrainian troops reclaim Kyiv suburb Makariv, says Army
83.article_body: The Ukrainian troops have pushed back Russian forces to reclaim the Kyiv suburb of Makariv, said the Army. "The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reported on March 21 that the Ukrainian flag was raised over the town of Makariv and Russian forces have been pushed back," reported The Kyiv Independent. Makariv lies 60 km west of Kyiv.

84.title: Completely unacceptable: Japan as Russia halts WW2 peace treaty talks
84.article_body: Japan on Tuesday condemned Russia's decision to abandon talks on a World War II peace treaty because of sanctions imposed by Tokyo over the war in Ukraine. "This entire situation has been created by Russia's invasion of Ukraine, and Russia's response to push this onto Japan-Russia relations is extremely unfair and completely unacceptable," Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said.

85.title: We have been eyeing Shreyas Iyer for years now: KKR CEO Venky Mysore
85.article_body: KKR CEO Venky Mysore has revealed they have been eyeing Shreyas Iyer for years and there was a "sense of real elation" when they bought him for ₹12.25 crore in the IPL mega auction. "We got our captain and a serious match-winner. At this young age, Shreyas has already achieved a lot and he'll only get better," Venky added.

86.title: NMMC cuts salaries of 191 employees for reporting late to work
86.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has cut salaries of 191 employees, including officers, for one-three days for reporting late to work, the civic body said. Following complaints, a surprise check was conducted on two occasions last month during which it was found that several employees reported late for work despite being warned against it, a senior official said.

87.title: Mumbai youth killed as friend without licence rides bike in wrong direction
87.article_body: A 19-year-old boy was arrested in Mumbai for driving a motorbike without a license, leading to the death of his 18-year-old friend, who was riding pillion, police said. The accident took place when three friends were returning home on a bike. The 19-year-old boy entered a one-way street from the wrong direction and was blinded by an approaching car's headlight.

88.title: 2-month-old girl found dead inside microwave oven in Delhi, mother main suspect: Police
88.article_body: A two-month-old girl was found dead inside a microwave oven at her home in Delhi. The baby's grandfather alleged, "We think her mother killed her...She was unhappy with her." A police officer said the mother of the child is the main suspect. DCP Benita Mary Jaiker said, "The cause of death is yet to be ascertained. We're questioning family members."

89.title: Which were the world's most polluted countries in 2021 as per World Air Quality Report?
89.article_body: As per the World Air Quality Report 2021 by Swiss organisation IQAir, Bangladesh was the most polluted country last year. Bangladesh was followed by Chad, Pakistan and Tajikistan. Meanwhile, India was the fifth most polluted country, followed by Oman, Kyrgyzstan, Bahrain, Iraq and Nepal. No country met the latest WHO air quality guideline for PM2.5 in 2021, the report added.

90.title: Bihar's people contributed to nation's development: Prez Kovind on 'Bihar Diwas'
90.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday greeted the people of Bihar on the occasion of 'Bihar Diwas'. "The hardworking and talented people here have contributed significantly to the development of the country," President Kovind, who served as Governor of Bihar from 2015-2017, wrote on Twitter. 'Bihar Diwas' is observed to mark the formation of the state of Bihar.

91.title: 2020, 2021 reminded us that we are human and need God: Justice Pardiwala
91.article_body: Gujarat High Court Justice Jamshed Pardiwala said years 2020 and 2021 have reminded us that we are human and we need God. "There has been an immense loss of lives and livelihoods...the years 2020 and 2021 have taught a lot about ourselves...what has kept us going are faith and hope," he said, adding the two years have been "unarguably horrible".

92.title: Marathi school Class 1 students to learn via bilingual books: Maha Min
92.article_body: Maharashtra School Education Minister Varsha Gaikwad said on Monday that bilingual and integrated books will be introduced for Class 1 students in Marathi medium schools from this academic year. She said that while students "understand better" when taught in their mother tongue, they should also "understand English words (for Marathi words)". Gaikwad was replying to queries in the state Assembly.

93.title: US firm uses waste from coal power plants to mine Bitcoin
93.article_body: US-based Stronghold Digital Mining claims to have devised a method to use waste left behind by coal power plants to power supercomputers working to mine Bitcoin. It collects coal ash from mines and processes it at a waste coal processing facility. The coal ash is sorted and crushed, and sent to a boiler building where it's burned to generate electricity.

94.title: Let's reaffirm our pledge to save every drop of water: PM on World Water Day
94.article_body: On World Water Day, PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that the nation is undertaking numerous measures to ensure water conservation. "On World Water Day, let's reaffirm our pledge to save every drop of water," PM tweeted. "Over the last few years, it's heartening to see water conservation become a mass movement," he added.

95.title: I-T dept raids Hiranandani Group at 24 places in Mumbai, B'luru & Chennai
95.article_body: The Income Tax department on Tuesday conducted raids on several premises linked to Hiranandani Group over suspected tax evasion. The raids were underway at around 24 locations in Mumbai, Chennai and Bengaluru, including residences of some top officials, department officials said. The group, founded by Niranjan and Surendra Hiranandani in 1978, is one of India's largest real estate companies.

96.title: Around 3.1 million trees cut for infra projects across India in 2020-21: Govt
96.article_body: Around 3.1 million trees were cut down for public infrastructure projects across India in 2020-21, Union Minister Bhupender Yadav told the Lok Sabha on Monday. "The permission for tree felling is accorded by the respective state governments/UT administrations under the provisions of various Acts, rules, guidelines and directions of courts," Yadav stated.

97.title: US-Moscow ties close to rupture after Biden's 'war criminal' remark: Russia
97.article_body: Russia on Monday summoned the US ambassador to the country in protest after US President Joe Biden labelled his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin a "war criminal" for Moscow's actions in Ukraine. "Such statements from the American President, unworthy of a statesman of such high rank, put Russian-American relations on the verge of rupture," the Russian Foreign Ministry said.

98.title: Punjab CM declares public holiday on March 23 on occasion of Shaheed Diwas
98.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann has declared a public holiday in the state on March 23, on the occasion of Shaheed Diwas or Martyrs' Day. Shaheed Diwas marks the death anniversary of freedom fighters Bhagat Singh, Sukhdev Thapar and Shivaram Rajguru. Punjab Assembly on Tuesday passed a resolution to install statues of Shaheed Bhagat Singh and Babasaheb Ambedkar in the Assembly.

99.title: Delhi's peak power demand may touch 8,000 MW for 1st time: Officials
99.article_body: Delhi's peak power demand may surpass 8,000 MW for the first time this summer after industrial and commercial activities resumed following COVID-19 lockdowns, officials said. Delhi's peak power demand was 7,409 MW which was recorded in 2019, according to BSES. In BSES Yamuna Power Limited areas of East and Central Delhi, the peak demand is expected to surpass 1,800 MW.

100.title: Payal verbally attacked, Kangana seems to agree abuses are justified: Sangram
100.article_body: Indian wrestler Sangram Singh said that his girlfriend Payal Rohatgi is not being allowed to speak on show 'Lock Upp'. "Everyone [has] used or verbally attacked her...Poonam and Anjali abuse Payal...no one fires them. Kangana seems to agree that abuses are justified...This is very unfair...You're killing someone's self-confidence with such uncalled for behaviour," Sangram added.

101.title: Tamil Nadu to induct women as firefighters, proposal sent to government
101.article_body: Director General of Police and Director of the fire department in Tamil Nadu, Braj Kishore Ravi, said that the department has sent a proposal to the government for inducting women as firefighters in its Fire and Rescue Services department. He said that the services have 22 women officers but women firefighters have never been included in the department till now.

102.title: Duo blame 'forbidden' gold for daughter's illness, cheat woman of ₹2.50 lakh; 1 held
102.article_body: A man was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly cheating a woman of gold and cash worth ₹2.50 lakh on the pretext of curing her daughter's illness. The man, along with an aide, claimed the gold jewellery the woman's daughter was wearing was forbidden under Islamic law and was causing her illness. The accused then allegedly took it away for "cleansing".

103.title: Gang of six assaults youth with sharp weapons in Pune, one held
103.article_body: Six people have been booked for allegedly physically assaulting a youth with sharp weapons in Pune, police officials said. The victim, Sandesh Lahu Kadu (20), lodged an FIR at the Kothrud police station in which he alleged that the attackers assaulted him due to some personal enmity. One of them is arrested while the remaining five are in the hideout.

104.title: Grammarly, founded by Ukrainians, continues to pay staffers who joined Ukraine army
104.article_body: Typing assistant Grammarly, whose co-founders are Ukrainians, is continuing to pay full salaries and benefits to its Ukraine-based employees who joined the army to fight Russian forces, its CEO said. Before the war, nearly half of its 600 employees were based in Ukraine, however, many of them have now fled. "The team is...focused on their safety," CEO Brad Hoover added.

105.title: Muslim family donates land worth ₹2.5 crore in Bihar for world's largest Hindu temple
105.article_body: A Muslim family has donated land worth ₹2.5 crore for the construction of the world's largest Hindu temple, Virat Ramayan Mandir, in Bihar. Acharya Kishore Kunal, chief of the Patna-based Mahavir Mandir Trust, that has undertaken the project, said that Ishtiyaq Ahmad Khan, who has donated the land, is a businessman from East Champaran based in Guwahati.

106.title: Chemveda Life Sciences to invest ₹150 crore for expansion in Hyd
106.article_body: Research organisation Chemveda Life Sciences will invest ₹150 crore to add a state-of-the-art Research and Development centre in Hyderabad, Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao announced on Monday. This comes following a meeting between a delegation led by Rao and the organisation in US' San Diego the same day. The centre will create jobs for 500 scientists, Rao said.

107.title: Auto drivers protest in Pune over pending dues of COVID-19 relief fund
107.article_body: Auto drivers on Monday protested in Pune over pending dues of the COVID-19 relief fund earlier declared by the Maharashtra government. "As a relief, funds were been given by the state government and still, we have not yet received it," a rickshaw panchayat auto union convenor said. The auto drivers protested outside the Pune District Collector office.

108.title: Sushmita Sen, ex-boyfriend Rohman seen together for first time post-breakup, pics surface
108.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen and her ex-boyfriend Rohman Shawl were spotted together in Mumbai for the first time after their breakup in December last year. Sushmita's younger daughter Alisah Sen was also seen accompanying them. While announcing her breakup in December last year, Sushmita wrote on Instagram, "We began as friends, we remain friends!! The relationship was long over...the love remains!!"

109.title: Condition was I didn't have to mimic Rishi: Paresh on 'Sharmaji Namkeen'
109.article_body: Actor Paresh Rawal who will be seen playing the same role as late actor Rishi Kapoor in the movie 'Sharmaji Namkeen', said that the condition for him was to not mimic Rishi. "That wouldn't have done it. I had to hold on to his characteristics, his pain, the theme of the character and the focal point," he added.

110.title: UP's ex-minister Swati Singh moves plea to divorce legislator husband
110.article_body: Ex-Minister in the previous Yogi Adityanath's government, Swati Singh, has moved application seeking divorce from her husband. Swati was denied party ticket in the recently concluded UP Assembly polls while her husband Dayashankar Singh had contested as BJP candidate from Balia seat and won. Earlier, Swati alleged that Dayashankar has been conspiring against her to obtain party ticket for himself.

111.title: New Delhi-based Leverage Edu raises $22 mn, Kunal Shah invests too
111.article_body: New Delhi-based edtech platform ﻿Leverage Edu has raised $22 million in its Series B round of financing. The financing round values the startup at $120 million. The round also saw participation from UAE-based NB Ventures, 9Unicorns, Mankind Pharma, Trifecta Ventures and Bennett Coleman, among others. CRED﻿ founder Kunal Shah, ﻿BookMyShow﻿ founder Ashish Hemrajani also participated in the round.

112.title: Kohli told me he wanted to enjoy his cricket, RCB will give that to him: Irfan
112.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said Virat Kohli recently told him that he wanted to enjoy his cricket. Irfan added, "RCB will give him that kind of pleasure...he'll definitely be an on-field mentor...and I think he'll enjoy that role." Irfan further said, "When you're a captain you're looking after the result...Kohli won't have that kind of responsibility he'll love that."

113.title: TMC panchayat leader killed in bomb attack in West Bengal's Birbhum
113.article_body: Bhadu Sheikh, a TMC panchayat leader of Barshal village in the Rampurhat area of West Bengal's Birbhum, was killed in an alleged bomb attack on Monday evening, police said. According to witnesses, the victim was attacked by four men on motorcycles, who had their faces covered. The incident took place days after two councillors were shot dead in the state.

114.title: Aamir's Lagaan made big impression on me; country connected with it: Rajamouli
114.article_body: During RRR's promotional event, actor Aamir Khan asked director SS Rajamouli, "How do you connect with so many people across the country?" To this, Rajamouli replied, "The way the entire country connected with 'Lagaan' made a big impression on me. I learned from 'Lagaan' that if I make my story based on...human emotions, I have a chance to connect with...people."

115.title: Fire breaks out at SBI zonal office in Ranchi, documents burnt
115.article_body: A fire broke out on fourth floor of the State Bank of India's zonal office located in Kutchery Chowk, Ranchi, Jharkhand during the wee hours on Tuesday. Several documents and other items were reportedly burnt in the incident. The police and fire department were immediately informed about the matter. Fire tenders reached the spot and managed to douse the flames.

116.title: Hyderabad Police Commissioner felicitates 382 police personnel
116.article_body: Hyderabad Police organised a promotion-cum-pipping ceremony on Monday to felicitate newly promoted police personnel. A total of 382 personnel, who were recently promoted from the rank of Constable to Head Constable, were felicitated by City Police Commissioner CV Anand. He also lauded the efforts of the promotees for their swift detection and apprehension of criminals.

117.title: Gujarat govt withdraws 10 cases linked to 2015 Patidar quota agitation
117.article_body: Gujarat government has withdrawn 10 cases lodged in connection with the 2015 Patidar quota agitation, Public Prosecutor Sudhir Brahmbhatt said. Except for a sedition case against Hardik Patel, no case regarding the agitation is pending in sessions court in Ahmedabad, he added. The court allowed withdrawal of seven cases and a city metropolitan magistrate court allowed withdrawal of three cases.

118.title: Wanted gangster, named in about 33 cases, shot dead by UP police
118.article_body: Wanted gangster Manish Singh, who was named in about 33 cases and carried a reward of ₹2 lakh, was shot dead by UP police in an encounter in Varanasi on Monday. The Special Task Force said the encounter broke out when two motorcycle-borne men fired at them when asked to stop. Singh was shot when police returned fire.

119.title: Elderly woman cheated of ₹2 lakh-gold jewellery at Pune post office
119.article_body: A case has been filed after a 68-year-old woman was allegedly cheated of gold jewellery worth ₹2 lakh by a person in the premises of Pune's post office under the pretext of a scheme to get money. The accused reportedly took jewellery bag from the woman's seven-year-old grandson while she went to get her Aadhaar photocopied and fled, police said.

120.title: Bengaluru reports 53 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
120.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 53 new COVID-19 cases and one coronavirus-related death, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahangara Palike (BBMP). The city also reported 110 recoveries in the last 24 hours. The number of active cases in the city now stands at 1,648 with a positivity rate of 0.73%, the data showed.

121.title: Russia used hypersonic missile to detract from stalled invasion: UK
121.article_body: Russia's alleged use of its hypersonic missile is probably intended to "detract from a lack of progress" in its ground campaign in Ukraine, UK's Defence Ministry said. Deployment of Kinzhal hypersonic missiles is "highly unlikely to materially affect the outcome of Russia's campaign in Ukraine", it added. Russia had claimed it'd fired several hypersonic missiles against targets in western Ukraine.

122.title: Defence procurement was nil for 10 yrs under UPA-led govt: Sitharaman
122.article_body: Defence procurement under the UPA-led government was nil for 10 years, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. "I want to tell that 10 years of Indian defence history recorded nil purchases. Sir, 10 years were lost. After 2014, rapidly, we had to buy from pin to aircraft, everything," Sitharaman added during a debate in the Rajya Sabha.

123.title: Parliamentary panel examining raising marriageable age for women gets 3-month extension
123.article_body: The Parliamentary Standing Committee examining the proposed increase in legal age of marriage for women to 21 years has been granted a three-month extension by Rajya Sabha Chairman Venkaiah Naidu. The panel was expected to submit its findings on the Prohibition of Child Marriage (Amendment) Bill by March 24. Now it has to submit its report by June 24.

124.title: HP University VC files nomination as BJP candidate for Rajya Sabha poll
124.article_body: Himachal Pradesh University vice-chancellor Sikander Kumar on Monday filed his nomination as BJP candidate for election to the lone vacant seat in Rajya Sabha from the state. The election has been necessitated as Congress MP Anand Sharma will complete his term on April 2. Notably, two of the three Rajya Sabha seats from the state are occupied by BJP.

125.title: Officer shoots himself dead inside a police station in Assam
125.article_body: An ASI rank police officer allegedly shot himself dead inside a police station in the Cachar district of Assam on Monday. "ASI Gour Bidhu Singh shot himself on his head using his service pistol... inside Silchar Sadar Police Station," said Ramandeep Kaur, SP (Cachar). She added that the reason behind the alleged suicide is yet to be ascertained.

126.title: L'Oréal Professionnel Paris holds 4th Indian Hairdressing Awards
126.article_body: L’Oréal Professionnel Paris is hosting the Indian Hairdressing Awards, which the brand says is the biggest competition of professional hairstylists in the country. This year over 17,500 hairdressers across India competed for the title, it revealed. For the first time, the award ceremony will be broadcasted live and viewers from across the world can watch it online.

127.title: If GT does well, I might get chance to play for India in WT20: Shubman Gill
127.article_body: Gujarat Titans batter Shubman Gill, who's yet to feature for India in T20Is, has said if the franchise does well in IPL 2022, then he might be considered for the T20 World Cup later this year. "I'd love to [open]...but if the team wants me to do a different role, I'm game," he added. Shubman scored 478 runs last season.

128.title: Delhi HC to hear plea on removing anti-Ramdev video links on May 10
128.article_body: The Delhi High Court would hear on May 10, pleas by Facebook, Twitter and Google, challenging an order directing them to globally block or disable links to a video containing defamatory allegations against Ramdev. The defamatory video contained excerpts of a book on Ramdev named "Godman to Tycoon" which the High Court restrained from publishing in its September 2018 order.

129.title: NATO should openly say they're not accepting us as they're scared of Russia: Zelenskyy
129.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has claimed that the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) was afraid of Russia. "NATO should either say now that they're accepting us, or openly say that they are not accepting us as they are scared of Russia, which is true," The Kyiv Independent quoted Zelenskyy as saying, in an interview to Suspilne, a Ukrainian public broadcaster.

130.title: Cow vigilantes beat up van driver over 'carrying beef' in UP
130.article_body: A 35-year-old van driver was allegedly beaten up by cow vigilantes on suspicion of carrying beef and smuggling cattle in Raal village in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura. Villagers also assaulted two other self-proclaimed cow vigilantes, who enquired about the incident, after mistaking them as the driver's associates, police said. Videos of the incident purportedly show the driver being beaten with belts.

131.title: His dignity is humbling: Mahindra on 125-yr-old Padma Shri awardee Swami Sivananda
131.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra shared a video of UP-based yoga guru Swami Sivananda receiving the Padma Shri award and wrote, "The power of yoga. A life spanning 125 years of dedication." "The grace and dignity of...Sivananda is both humbling & inspiring. Proud to belong to the country of yoga's origin," he tweeted. Sivananda knelt before PM Narendra Modi at the ceremony.

132.title: All the emotions that came out on screen were real: The Kashmir Files actor
132.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher's niece, Vrinda Kher, who played the role of Bhawani Kaul, a Kashmiri Pandit in the film said the "gruesome" climax scene really shook her. The scene shows actor Bhasha Sumbli, playing the role of a displaced Kashmiri Pandit, Sharda Pandit, being stripped by terrorists in a migrant camp. She added, "All the emotions...came out on screen were...real."

133.title: I had suggested Jayalalithaa be taken abroad for treatment: O Panneerselvam
133.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister O Panneerselvam told an Inquiry Commission that he had suggested that former Chief Minister late J Jayalalithaa be taken abroad for her treatment. "Health Minister told me he would discuss possibility with Apollo Hospitals and later informed me Vijayakumar Reddy told him Jayalalithaa's health had improved and she could be discharged in week," Panneerselvam added.

134.title: Will not accept Russian ultimatums to end war: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
134.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Ukraine would never bow to "ultimatums from Russia" to end the war. The only way Russian forces can capture cities such as Mariupol, Kyiv or Kharkiv is to "kill everyone", he added. Zelenskyy insisted that a meeting with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin "in any format" is needed to end the war in Ukraine.

135.title: 18-year-old Hindu girl shot dead in Pakistan for resisting abduction: Reports
135.article_body: An 18-year-old Hindu girl was shot dead in Pakistan's Sindh province for resisting abduction, as per reports. The girl identified as Pooja Oad was said to have reportedly been shot dead in the middle of the street in Rohi, Sukkur. Every year, several women belonging to minority communities in Pakistan are abducted and forcibly converted by religious extremists, reports added.

136.title: Ex-J&K CM Omar Abdullah receives COVID vaccine certificates of 4 people
136.article_body: Jammu Kashmir National Conference Vice President and former CM of erstwhile J&K state Omar Abdullah tweeted that he received COVID-19 vaccination certificates of four people on his phone. "Dear Ashina, Kareem, Prashanth and Ameena. Congratulations for your first COVID-19 vaccine however I've no idea who you guys are and why you gave my mobile number for your certificates," Abdullah wrote.

137.title: South Africa once needed 22 off 13 balls, rain rule made it 21 off 1
137.article_body: South Africa needed 22 runs off 13 balls to win the World Cup semi-final against England on March 22, 1992 when rain stopped play. When the play resumed, South Africa's target was revised to 21 off 1 ball due to the rain rule, according to which reduction in target was proportionate to lowest-scoring overs of side batting first.

138.title: Train coach with 90 onboard derails at J'khand's Tatanagar station, none injured
138.article_body: The coach of a train with 90 people on board derailed at Tatanagar Junction railway station in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur on Monday, the Railways said. No one sustained injuries and all the passengers were later accommodated in alternative coaches, it added. The incident took place when the second-last coach of the Mumbai CSMT-Howrah Weekly Superfast Express derailed while entering the platform.

139.title: Alphabet's Waymo to remove safety drivers from self-driving cars in US
139.article_body: Google-parent Alphabet's self-driving tech unit Waymo said it is ready to remove safety drivers from its autonomous vehicles in San Francisco. In August, Waymo had started providing free autonomous rides to a limited number of people in San Francisco, with safety drivers on board. California earlier in March allowed Waymo to charge riders for trips with safety drivers.

140.title: Working with Prashant on bringing change in country: T'gana CM KCR
140.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Monday said that he's working with political strategist Prashant Kishor on bringing a "parivartan (change)" in the entire country. He called Kishor his "best friend" for the last seven and a half years, adding that he isn't a paid worker. "There's a vacuum in national politics. I'm pursuing national politics now," he further said.

141.title: Kashmiri Pandits got us food, 85-yr-old lady fed us: 'The Kashmir...' producer
141.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' producer Abhishek Agarwal said Kashmiri Pandits used to get food for team while they were shooting for the film. "I don't remember having relished food from outside. A lady who must have been about 85 years old would feed us food," he said, adding actor Anupam Kher and director Vivek Agnihotri would "shed tears" after every scene.

142.title: Been a long journey, I gave it all vs Viktor but it wasn't meant to be: Lakshya
142.article_body: India's 20-year-old shuttler Lakshya Sen has thanked his supporters and well-wishers after winning the silver at the All England Open Badminton Championships. "It's been a long journey from Almora to All England Open final. I gave it my all vs [world number one] Viktor Axelsen but it wasn't meant to be," he stated. Lakshya lost the final 10-21, 15-21.

143.title: Felt insulted that my report on farm laws only gathered dust: Anil Ghanwat
143.article_body: Farm leader Anil Ghanwat said that he "felt insulted" after his report, along with two others, on the now-repealed three farm laws gathered "dust for over a year". In a conversation with the Indian Express, Ghanwat said that he and other members of the SC-appointed committee "had put in serious efforts to compile the report during the challenging Covid-19 times".

144.title: Manoj Bajpayee is the biggest star in India today, not Salman: Shekhar Kapur
144.article_body: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur said Bollywood will be "completely shattered and unsuccessful if we try to tell the stories". "If you walk around in India today, who is the biggest star? It is not Salman Khan, it is Manoj Bajpayee...because everybody is shifting to OTT," added Shekhar. "We are arrogant enough to call ourselves storytellers...We provoke," stated Shekhar.

145.title: Delhi's Ashram underpass to open for traffic trials from today
145.article_body: Delhi's 750-metre-long Ashram underpass will be opened for traffic trials from Tuesday, three years after work began on the project, as per PWD officials. The underpass is built between the Nizamuddin railway bridge and CSIR Apartments which is Delhi's most critical and traffic-intensive stretches. This underpass project is reportedly one of the most delayed infrastructure projects in Delhi.

146.title: Doesn't matter if 32 or 50 people die after having spurious liquor In Bihar: JDU MLA
146.article_body: Janata Dal (United) MLA Gopal Mandal said, "It doesn’t matter if 32 people die or 50 after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar." Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has closed all liquor shops in the state long ago, Mandal added. "Senior police officers are connected to liquors smugglers for their personal benefits," Mandal stated.

147.title: India reports 1,581 new COVID-19 cases, 33 deaths in 24 hours
147.article_body: India has reported 1,581 new COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 33 deaths, 11 deaths occurred during the day in the country, while 22 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,16,543, and the active cases declined to 23,913.

148.title: I wouldn't have made 'Runway 34' if Big B wouldn't have said yes: Ajay
148.article_body: Ajay Devgn said he was certain to cast Amitabh Bachchan for his film 'Runway 34' and had no other casting choice. "In this film, for Mr Bachchan's role, if he wouldn't have agreed, I don't even know if I would be able to cast (any other actor)." Speaking about Amitabh, Ajay said, "I haven't seen any other hardworking, professional actor."

149.title: Punjab man blames roommate for eviction from rented house, sets him on fire
149.article_body: A 27-year-old man was set on fire by his roommate, Aman, after the latter was evicted by landlord from a rented accommodation in Punjab. Aman blamed Raj for his eviction and set him on fire after pouring petrol on him on Sunday. Raj was taken to civil hospital where doctors said he suffered 55 per cent burns.

150.title: US declares Myanmar military committed genocide against Rohingyas
150.article_body: The United States has formally declared that Myanmar military committed genocide against Rohingya Muslims. "Members of the Burmese military committed genocide and crimes against humanity against Rohingyas," said US Secretary of State Antony Blinken. "Only seven times since the Holocaust has the US concluded that genocide was committed. Today, at the Holocaust Museum, marks the eighth," he added.

151.title: Raj's Kota imposes Sec 144 till April 21 in view of 'The Kashmir Files' screening
151.article_body: Section 144 of CrPC has been imposed in Rajasthan's Kota from March 22 to April 21 in order to maintain law and order during screening of 'The Kashmir Files'. "Kota is highly vulnerable from communal point of view. Dharnas...due to the film, deaths of youth while bathing in Chambal river during upcoming festivals may affect...public order," an official order states.

152.title: I was sick, took medication, but I'm happy: Khawaja on 91 in Lahore Test
152.article_body: Australia batter Usman Khawaja has revealed that he was a bit sick and was getting medication during the breaks in his 91-run innings against Pakistan in the ongoing Lahore Test. "I wasn't feeling well at all...[but] I just told myself, 'Just keep going, go as long as you can'...[and] I'm actually really happy with it," he stated.

153.title: Illegal firearms used in Prayagraj during Holi, police to conduct drive
153.article_body: Illegal firearms were found to have been used in two incidents during Holi in UP’s Prayagraj, which resulted in the death of four persons. Now, the police have decided to carry out a fresh drive against illegal weapons. The district police have arrested many persons with illegal firearms and ammunition, in the last few years.

154.title: Siddhant Chaturvedi mourns 24-year-old rapper MC Tod Fod's demise, shares Instagram chat
154.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi took to Instagram Stories to mourn the demise of 24-year-old rapper MC Tod Fod, who had featured in the film 'Gully Boy'. Sharing an Instagram chat from 2019, Siddhant wrote, "RIP bhai" and added a broken heart emoji. In the chat, Siddhant praised MC Tod Fod for the song 'India 91'.

155.title: No survivors found in crash of Chinese plane carrying 132 people
155.article_body: No survivors have been found as the search continued of the scattered wreckage of a China Eastern plane carrying 132 people that crashed on Monday. "Wreckage of the plane was found at the scene, but up until now, none of those aboard the plane with whom contact was lost have been found," state broadcaster CCTV said.

156.title: Nationalism infused in J&K post abrogation of Article 370: Kailash Vijayvargiya
156.article_body: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya on Monday said that the social and political ecosystem of Jammu and Kashmir is being improved post the abrogation of Article 370. "The sense of nationalism has been infused in the hearts of the people of Jammu and Kashmir by the government," said Vijayvargiya before watching the movie 'The Kashmir Files'.

157.title: Former PRO to Odisha Governor, CM arrested in murder case
157.article_body: A retired civil servant from Odisha Niranjan Sethi, who had served as public relation officer (PRO) to a former Governor and former Chief Minister, was arrested in connection with the murder of a cameraman of a web channel, police said. "The victim was killed over a purported sex scandal videotape that includes...politicians and police officers," Jatin Panda, ASP Bhadrak, added.

158.title: Spent sleepless nights over ₹16 lakh down payment: Anil Agarwal on buying his 1st firm
158.article_body: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal on Monday shared how he acquired a bankrupt company named Shamsher Sterling Cable Company in May 1976. "I had no experience on how to buy a company, but I went ahead anyway," he wrote. Agarwal revealed that he "spent many sleepless nights thinking" about the down payment but managed to gather ₹16 lakh through loans.

159.title: Was told I'm a 'gas tanker': Raashii Khanna on bullying in film industry
159.article_body: 'Rudra: The Edge of Darkness' actress Raashii Khanna, while talking about criticism she has faced in the industry, said that she was called a "gas tanker". "I don't say anything because I was quite big for the mainstream that they have. And I did become fitter in time, not to please anybody...So I've faced all that bullying," Raashii added.

160.title: Harden cyber defences: Biden warns of Russian cyberattacks on US companies
160.article_body: US President Joe Biden has urged American companies to "harden" their cyber defences "immediately" amid "evolving intelligence" that Russia could target American firms and critical infrastructure with cyberattacks in response to US sanctions over Ukraine invasion. "The magnitude of Russia's cyber capacity is fairly consequential, and...the...government is doing its part to get ready," Biden added.

161.title: Imran Khan! Your game is over, Shehbaz Sharif to be PM candidate: Maryam Nawaz
161.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter Maryam Nawaz has said that her party, PML-N, will nominate Shehbaz Sharif, her uncle, as PM candidate if incumbent Imran Khan fails to pass no-confidence motion. "Imran Khan! Your game is over. The Prime Minister is aware that no one will come to his rescue now that he has lost the game," she said.

162.title: India has been somewhat shaky in terms of dealing with Putin's aggression: Biden
162.article_body: US President Joe Biden said that India has been somewhat shaky in terms of dealing with Russian President Vladimir Putin's aggression against Ukraine. "[In the Quad], Japan has been extremely strong, so has Australia," he added. Biden further asserted that Putin didn't anticipate how unified NATO and western allies would be in a global response to his invasion of Ukraine.

163.title: Tumakuru bus accident survivors seek concessions in upcoming exams
163.article_body: Several students who got injured in the recent bus accident in Tumakuru have sought concessions in the upcoming examinations. "Our preparations were affected by the accident and the subsequent treatment," said one of the eight injured students. "We have asked the officials who visited us to ask the government to give us concessions with regard to the examinations," said students.

164.title: BJP MP calls Gadkari 'Spiderman', says he's 'built web of roads'
164.article_body: BJP MP Tapir Gao on Monday called Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari a "Spiderman". He said that like a spider, Gadkari has built a "web of roads in every corner of this country". Gao said this in Lok Sabha while participating in a debate on the demands for grants of the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways.

165.title: Traffic to be disrupted for 10 hrs on Delhi-Gurugram Expressway tomorrow
165.article_body: Traffic on the Delhi-Gurugram Expressway is likely to be disrupted for nearly 10 hours on Wednesday as the highway will be closed for traffic from 7am to 5pm, the Gurugram traffic police said. The highway will be closed due to a proposed march in support of the demand for the creation of an Ahir regiment in the Indian Army.

166.title: I went back to my playing days as captain during auction: LSG mentor Gambhir
166.article_body: LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir has revealed that he went back to playing days as captain to gauge what their captain KL Rahul would feel about the players they were investing in during the IPL mega auction. "I was trying to think like the captain...[to] understand what KL would have felt," Gambhir stated. LSG will face GT on March 28.

167.title: Pune temple decorated with 2,000 kg grapes for Sankashti Chaturthi
167.article_body: Pictures of Pune's Dagadusheth Halwai Ganpati temple decorated with 2,000 kg grapes on the occasion of Sankashti Chaturthi has surfaced online. The grapes used for the decoration were grown by Nashik's Sahyadri Farmers Producer Company, the temple's trust said. A member of the farmers' company said that the grapes will be distributed to various NGOs and hospitals as 'prasada'.

168.title: 17-year-old drowns in Pune Municipal Corporation swimming pool
168.article_body: A 17-year-old boy drowned in a swimming pool run by Pune Municipal Corporation in Wanwadi on Sunday, police said. The deceased had gone to the pool with friends, police added. The others came out of the pool due to alleged impure water but the victim could not be found. He was later found in an unconscious state, police stated.

169.title: Case registered against Mumbai firm for cheating Axis Bank of ₹42.5 crore
169.article_body: Mumbai Police has registered a loan fraud case against a private firm for allegedly cheating Axis Bank of ₹42.5 crore. Police said the firm allegedly availed cash credit facility from the bank, but failed to repay it. Forensic auditing of the firm's accounts revealed that it used the money for purposes other than what it had claimed while availing loan.

170.title: Hyderabad Police launch fitness drive for city police personnel
170.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand on Monday launched a 'Health and Fitness' programme for the city police personnel. The drive, launched in collaboration with NGO Helping Hand Foundation, will help promote fitness among 17,500 police staff. The programme is designed on WHO-recommended protocols and will have three components- screening, counselling and fitness.

171.title: Cleartrip 'Big Travel Sale' offers discounts on flights & hotels
171.article_body: Travel booking platform, Cleartrip has come up with 'Big Travel Sale' starting 22nd March. The campaign features celebrities like Shruti Haasan, Ravi Shastri, Mithila Palkar, and Dhruv Sehgal. Travellers can avail flat 25% off* on domestic hotels, flat 12% off* on domestic flights, and up to 15% off* on international flights. The sale ends on 31st March.

172.title: DRDO scientist held in Rohini blast case was inspired by shootout: Police
172.article_body: A 47-year-old DRDO scientist Bharat Bhushan Kataria, arrested in December 2021, in Rohini blast case was "inspired" by Rohini courtroom shootout in which three gangsters were killed, Delhi Police Special Cell said. He was held for allegedly planting a bomb in a tiffin carrier in Rohini court complex. Kataria allegedly wanted to take revenge on his neighbour, the chargesheet claims.

173.title: Cardiologist sacked after deaths of 3 patients at Delhi's Rajiv Gandhi hospital
