Singh was administered the oath of office by Manipur Governor La Ganesan at Raj Bhavan in Imphal. Five MLAs, including Nemcha Kipgen, Yumnam Khemchand Singh, Thongam Biswajit Singh, Awangbou Newmai and Govindas Konthoujam, were also sworn in as Cabinet ministers of the state.

348.title: Numbers are part of journey not destination: Ashwin on 442 Test wickets
348.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin, who recently became India's second highest wicket-taker in Tests after he surpassed Kapil Dev's tally of 434 wickets, said it's humbling to see what he's been able to do in terms of numbers. The off-spinner added that numbers are a part of journey rather than the destination. Ashwin has taken 442 wickets from 86 Tests so far.

349.title: No proposal from RBI on crypto trading mechanism yet: Govt
349.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Monday said the RBI has not yet proposed any mechanism for the trading of crypto assets. He said the cryptocurrency sector's legal framework "may be finalised only after all aspects are carefully examined". Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman had earlier proposed a 30% tax on income earned from crypto transactions in Budget 2022.

350.title: BJP announces 6 more names, completes list for all 36 UP MLC seats
350.article_body: After announcing candidates on 30 seats, BJP has now announced candidates on six more seats for the upcoming UP Legislative Council elections in which 36 MLC seats will be contested. The BJP's list comprises of several defectors including those from BSP, SP and Congress. Currently, BJP has 35 MLCs while SP has 17 MLCs in the 100-member UP Legislative Council.

351.title: Mandeep Singh's last-minute goal helps India beat Argentina 4-3
351.article_body: Striker Mandeep Singh's last-minute goal helped India beat Argentina by 4-3 in the FIH Pro League match in Bhubaneswar on Sunday. Argentina were trailing 0-2 at half-time but the 2016 Olympic champion managed to equalise in the final quarter until Mandeep scored with just 26 seconds remaining. Defender Varun Kumar was named the 'Player of the Match' for his performance.

352.title: B'luru zoo holds awareness session to mark World Sparrow Day
352.article_body: Bengaluru Bannerghatta Biological Park tweeted on Sunday that it held an awareness session for visitors to mark World Sparrow Day and Global Recycling Day. The awareness session was about the ecological importance of sparrows and the threats and ways to conserve them by recycling items and creating nest boxes, feeders and water troughs, the zoo said.

353.title: Will try to better my 2nd inning of politics: Supriyo on Bengal by-polls
353.article_body: Ahead of West Bengal Assembly by-elections, Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Babul Supriyo said on Monday that he'll try to better his "second inning of politics". Supriyo, who is TMC's candidate from the Ballygunge seat, filed his nomination for the polls today. Supriyo had resigned as Union Minister and BJP's MP from Asansol in 2021 citing "politics of hatred" as reason.

354.title: Delhi's Pragati Maidan corridor to be opened in a month: Deputy CM
354.article_body: The Pragati Maidan road corridor and tunnel project is almost complete and will open in a month, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said on Monday. After reviewing the project's progress, Sisodia tweeted, "This corridor will soon ease traffic in and around Ring Road and India Gate." Under the project, Delhi's PWD is constructing a 1.2-km-long tunnel and six underpasses.

355.title: Temple idol in Noida vandalised, police launch probe
355.article_body: The police said that an idol in a temple in Noida's Behlolpur village was found vandalised on Monday morning. "A police team along with forensic experts and a dog squad reached the site to look into the matter immediately," a senior police officer said. "Some blood samples were...found there which prima facie look like human blood," the officer added.

356.title: Kraigg Brathwaite breaks record for playing most deliveries in a Test by a West Indian
356.article_body: West Indies captain Kraigg Brathwaite has broken the record for playing most deliveries in a Test match by a West Indian. The 29-year-old played a total of 673 deliveries in the second Test against England in Barbados. He surpassed the previous record of 582 deliveries set by Brian Lara against England in 2004.

357.title: Hyd Police to organise job fair on Mar 26; 30 companies to participate
357.article_body: Hyderabad Police will organise a 'Mega Job Mela' on March 26, the official Twitter handle of Banjara Hills SHO tweeted on Saturday. The job fair will be held from 9:30 am onwards at the Sri Kotla Vijaya Bhaskar Reddy Stadium. As many as 30 companies, including ICICI Bank, will participate in the event to recruit over 3,000 people, police added.

358.title: Told govt 'don't repeal farm laws, it'd be unfair to majority': SC panel member
358.article_body: Anil Ghanwat, who was part of the SC-appointed panel examining the farm laws, has said the committee advised the government against repealing the laws. The repeal would be unfair to the 'silent' (not part of protest) majority of farmers who support the laws, the panel told the government according to Ghanwat. Most farmers' organisations consulted, supported the laws, he revealed.

359.title: China to send additional aid worth nearly ₹12 crore to Ukraine
359.article_body: Chinese Red Cross will offer an additional humanitarian aid worth 10 million yuan (nearly ₹12 crore) to Ukraine amid its conflict with Russia, Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said on Monday. This takes aid pledged by China to Ukraine to 15 million yuan (nearly ₹18 crore). Earlier, UN said that 902 civilians have been killed in Ukraine since February 24.

360.title: His leg-side play, flicks are wonderful: Sangakkara on RR's Padikkal
360.article_body: Asked about any aspect of game he'd like to have from Devdutt Padikkal, RR Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara said the batter's leg-side play and flicks are wonderful. "He's such an exciting player, so accomplished. I just want him to know how valuable he is for...team" he added. Padikkal was bought by RR for ₹7.75 crore in mega auction 2022.

361.title: He is Aatmanirbhar: Anand Mahindra on 19-year-old's midnight run in Noida
361.article_body: Sharing the viral video of a 19-year-old man running in Noida at midnight, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra said, "He is Aatmanirbhar!" While he refused a lift offered by filmmaker Vinod Kapri, Mahindra wrote, "This is indeed inspiring. But you know what my Monday Motivation is? The fact that he is so independent and refuses the offer of a ride."

362.title: I don't belong here, I don't belong there: Afghanistan's ex-FM driving Uber in US
362.article_body: Khalid Payenda, who resigned as Afghanistan's Finance Minister as the Taliban took over the country in August 2021, is now working as an Uber driver in the US, The Washington Post reported. "Right now, I don't have any place. I don't belong here and I don't belong there," Payenda said. He also works as an adjunct professor at Georgetown University.

363.title: Renault resumes production at Moscow plant
363.article_body: French automobile manufacturer Renault has resumed production at its plant in Moscow. Renault suspended operations at its car assembly plant in Moscow in late February due to logistics bottlenecks that caused component shortages. According to ratings agency Fitch, Renault generated 10% of its revenue and around 12% of its operating profit margin in the country in 2021.

364.title: We're helpless: Medical student back from China on training recognition
364.article_body: Murshid Aleen, an Indian student studying MBBS in a Chinese university, who came back in 2020 spoke about physical training in India. "It's been two years since we have been attending online classes...Most of us are doing are practicals at various government and private hospitals in Kerala, but is not recognised...we are helpless right now," Aleen said.

365.title: 61 of 73 farmers' bodies consulted fully supported farm laws: SC panel report
365.article_body: A member of the SC-appointed panel on the farm laws has said that 61 of 73 farmers' organisations (representing over 3.83 crore farmers) interviewed, fully supported the repealed laws. Making details of the panel's report public, Anil Ghanwat said protesting farmers didn't engage with the panel. MSP played no role in the lives of farmers who were consulted, he added.

366.title: Nadda arrives in Imphal ahead of N Biren Singh's oath taking ceremony
366.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda arrived in Imphal on Monday, ahead of the swearing-in ceremony of Manipur CM- designate N Biren Singh. He is going to be the CM of Manipur for the second time, the BJP announced on Sunday. Singh was unanimously elected as the CM in the Manipur BJP legislature party meeting in Imphal.

367.title: Startups get up to 10 years for converting debt investment into equity
367.article_body: The government has extended the timeline for startups to convert debt investment made in the company into equity shares to 10 years, according to a press note by DPIIT. Startups previously had up to 5 years to convert their debt investment into equity effective from the day of issuance of convertible note.

368.title: 3 CRPF personnel injured as Maoists attack security camp in Chhattisgarh
368.article_body: Three Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel sustained injuries after Maoists allegedly opened fire at a security camp in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district using country-made weapons, police said. The injured personnel are stable and have been airlifted to Raipur for better treatment, Bastar Inspector General of Police said. The Maoists also allegedly hurled locally-made grenades, police added.

369.title: Retired General offers to help 19-yr-old get into Army after his viral running video
369.article_body: Reacting to the video of a 19-year-old man running in Noida at midnight, a Retired Army General offered his help. In reference to his wish to join the Army, Lt General Satish Dua tweeted, "To help him pass the recruitment tests on his merit, I've interacted with Colonel of Kumaon Regiment...He's doing the needful to train the boy for recruitment."

370.title: Bombay HC rejects plea to stay OTT release of Ranveer Singh's '83'
370.article_body: The Bombay High Court has rejected Mad Man Film Ventures' plea against the makers of Ranveer Singh-starrer '83' to stay its release on OTT platforms. The plea had alleged copyright infringement, adding that Mad Man had not granted its consent to the platforms to broadcast the film. The court however upheld the exploitation rights of Reliance Entertainment Studios Pvt Ltd.

371.title: Kissed my friend while I was married to Karan; got attracted to him: Nisha
371.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant, Nisha Rawal revealed on the show that she had kissed another man while she was married to her ex-husband Karan Mehra. Nisha said, "I met an old friend...I confided in him about...lot of things apart from the abusive past." "I...got attracted to him...I kissed that person. [But] I confessed [to Karan] that day itself," she added.

372.title: Australia name Daniel Vettori as spin consultant for ODIs, T20I vs Pak
372.article_body: Former New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori has been appointed as Australia's spin consultant for the white-ball leg of their ongoing series against Pakistan. Australia are currently playing their third and final Test against Pakistan in Lahore, which will be followed by a three-match ODI series, beginning on March 29. Australia will also play a lone T20I on April 5.

373.title: Examining educational concerns of evacuated students from Ukraine: Centre to SC
373.article_body: The Central government on Monday told the Supreme Court that the Government of India has evacuated 22,500 students from Ukraine and it is also looking into their educational concerns. "A mammoth task has been completed," the Attorney General of India, KK Venugopal, told the apex court. The apex court then closed the two petitions pending before it on the issue.

374.title: US to declare Rohingya repression in Myanmar a 'genocide': Officials
374.article_body: The US is set to declare the violence committed on the Rohingya Muslims by the Myanmar military a 'genocide' on Monday, officials have said. This comes as Myanmar is already facing accusations of genocide at the International Court of Justice (ICJ). Myanmar military began a crackdown on Rohingya community in 2017, reportedly forcing over 7,00,000 people to flee the country.

375.title: Have met kids who saw their parents being murdered: Pallavi on 'The Kashmir..'
375.article_body: Actress Pallavi Joshi said that she and husband Vivek Agnihotri researched for 'The Kashmir Files' for more than four years. "We went to...USA, UK, Germany, Singapore, Jammu and Kashmir, Pune, Thailand, Delhi...wherever we could find first family of the victim...whose father was murdered, whose mother was raped, children who saw their parents being murdered...We have met those people," she added.

376.title: Siddhant and I are good friends, I call us Tom and Jerry: Ananya
376.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday in an interview has revealed that she is good friends with actor and 'Gehraiyaan' co-star Siddhant Chaturvedi. "I call us Tom and Jerry because we fight a lot," the actress added. In a 2020 interview, Siddhant had responded to Ananya talking about the struggles she faced in Bollywood saying, "Their struggle begins where our dreams come true."

377.title: What's the case involving 'Child Q', the 15-yr-old Black girl strip-searched in London?
377.article_body: A 15-year-old Black girl was strip-searched while she was menstruating at her school in London by police officers after she was wrongly suspected of carrying drugs. The incident which took place in 2020 has come to light this month. Thousands of people took part in protests in London in support of the girl, who is now known as 'Child Q'.

378.title: Is it against my job to be educated: Nakuul on article on actors' qualifications
378.article_body: Actor Nakuul Mehta on Monday shared an article titled 'Educational qualifications of...actors will leave you stunned'. He wrote, "Why must it leave you stunned? Does it go against my job to be educated?" Actress Nikita Dutta replied to his tweet writing, "Educated no. But well-read yes," while journalist Surbhi Dutta wrote, "It shows...society's mindset and how it looks at showbiz."

379.title: Saffron flag may become national flag if Hindus unite: RSS leader
379.article_body: RSS leader Kalladka Prabhakar Bhat said if Hindus unite, the "Bhagwa Dwaj" (saffron flag) may become the national flag. "It can and should happen if Hindu Samaj comes together," Bhat said. "If a majority of people vote in Parliament and Rajya Sabha in favour of changing the National Flag, then the flag can be changed," Bhat stated.

380.title: 3,677 traffic e-challans issued in GB Nagar on Sunday: Police
380.article_body: Traffic police in Gautam Buddha Nagar on Sunday issued 3,677 e-challans to vehicle owners for various violations, officials said. This was part of a special campaign carried out by the police in the district. "During the campaign, police officials were deployed at all intersections and other important locations where they checked the offenders," a police spokesperson said.

381.title: Zelenskyy praises Mila Kunis & Ashton Kutcher after they raise $35 mn for Ukraine
381.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday thanked Hollywood couple Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis, who have been able to collect over $35 million for Ukraine through their fundraiser. Zelenskyy shared a picture of the three of them on a video call and wrote, "They inspire the world." Mila Kunis was born in Chernivtsi in Ukraine.

382.title: 3 siblings killed, 1 injured as dilapidated house collapses in Gujarat
382.article_body: Three siblings died and their 18-year-old sister sustained injuries when their house collapsed in Gujarat's Bharuch on Monday, police said. The single-storey dilapidated house caved in while the children's parents were away at work. The four children were pulled out from under the rubble by fire brigade personnel and taken to a hospital, where three of them were pronounced dead.

383.title: PSG lose 0-3, suffer their worst defeat against Monaco in 23 years
383.article_body: Ligue 1 leaders Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) were beaten 0-3 by Monaco, with forward Wissam Ben Yedder scoring two goals. This was Monaco's biggest league win against PSG since 1999, according to Ligue 1 statistics. Notably, PSG took the field on Sunday without Lionel Messi and Sergio Ramos. PSG are placed top of the Ligue 1 table with nine matches remaining.

384.title: Leopard sighted at Mercedes-Benz India campus in Pune, employees evacuated
384.article_body: A leopard was sighted on the campus of Mercedes-Benz India in Pune on Monday, following which, employees were evacuated to a safe spot. The leopard was rescued by forest department officials with the help of local police. Reports said that the leopard will soon be taken to a transit facility in Junnar.

385.title: Musk's Starlink helping Ukrainian drone unit destroy Russian tanks at night
385.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk-led SpaceX's Starlink system is helping a Ukrainian drone unit destroy Russian tanks and command trucks. "If we use a drone with thermal vision at night, the drone must connect through Starlink to the artillery guy and create target acquisition," the unit's leader told The Times. Starlink ensures the teams can work even during internet or power outages.

386.title: Video shows fire in Chinese mountains where flight with 133 passengers crashed
386.article_body: A video has shown fire breaking out in the mountains in China where a China Eastern Airlines flight carrying 133 passengers crashed on Monday. Flight MU5735 got lost during its route from Kunming to Guangzhou, reported China's state-affiliated ShanghaiEye. The jet involved in the accident was a Boeing 737 aircraft and the number of casualties wasn't immediately known, Reuters reported.

387.title: 'The Kashmir..' reveals inhuman horror of religious bigotry: UP CM
387.article_body: Uttar Pradesh caretaker Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath took to Twitter to share a picture with the team of 'The Kashmir Files'. "The film The Kashmir Files boldly reveals the inhuman horror of religious bigotry and terrorism. Undoubtedly, this film will work to make society and country aware. Congratulations to entire team for producing such a thought-provoking film," the tweet read.

388.title: Maha to probe alleged funds misuse under former BJP govt's scheme
388.article_body: Maharashtra Women and Child Development Minister Yashomati Thakur said on Monday that the state government will be setting up a committee to probe the alleged misappropriation of state funds under the 'Prajwala' scheme of the previous BJP government. Thakur said this in the state Legislative Council following a calling to attention notice by Shiv Sena leader Manisha Kayande.

389.title: 2 Pak lawmakers booked for protesting against dissident party member
389.article_body: Two provincial lawmakers of Pakistan PM Imran Khan-led PTI have been booked for protesting outside the residence of the party's dissident national assembly member Ramesh Kumar Vankwani in Karachi. An FIR was registered against Shah Nawaz Jadoon, Saeed Ullah Afridi and several other party members. This comes days ahead of the no-confidence motion against PM Khan.

390.title: It was a tough call: Rahul on leaving PBKS after IPL 2021
390.article_body: LSG's newly-appointed captain KL Rahul has opened on leaving PBKS after four years, stating that it was a tough call but he wanted to see if there's a "new journey" for him. "Wanted to see what's in store for me...I've been attached to Punjab for a long time...[but] I wanted to see if I can do something else," Rahul explained.

391.title: I work at McD in Noida, run 10 km every night to join Army: 19-yr-old in viral video
391.article_body: Pradeep Mehra, the 19-year-old youth whose video of running in the midnight in Noida went viral after being shared by filmmaker Vinod Kapri, said that he does so as he wants to "join the Army". Mehra, who works at Noida Sector-16's McDonald's, runs from his work to Barola every night, covering 10 kilometres. He rejected Kapri's offer for a lift.

392.title: BJP MP gives Zero Hour notice in Rajya Sabha demanding Uniform Civil Code
392.article_body: BJP MP Harnath Singh Yadav on Monday submitted a Zero Hour notice in Rajya Sabha demanding the implementation of Uniform Civil Code (UCC) in the country. Notably, the party had promised to bring UCC in Uttarakhand ahead of the assembly elections. Months ago, the Centre had told Delhi High Court that there is no immediate plan to implement UCC.

393.title: Video shows Tesla jumping 50 ft in air before crashing during a stunt in US
393.article_body: The Los Angeles police shared a video of a Tesla car speeding and flying 50 ft in the air before it crashed into parked cars and trash cans. It was reportedly driven by a rental driver, who was performing a stunt at a meet-up of Tesla users. The police have announced a reward of $1,000 for information about the driver.

394.title: Words 'f***ing' & 'b**ch' removed from Telugu version of RRR: Reports
394.article_body: The pan-India film 'RRR', starring actors Ram Charan and Jr NTR, reportedly had to undergo several cuts, days ahead of its release. According to reports, the Telugu version of 'RRR' has been granted a U/A certificate with three audio cuts. The abusive words like 'f***ing* and 'b**ch' were asked to be removed by the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC).

395.title: Challenges like pandemic, war make it important for India to be self-reliant: PM
395.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has said challenges faced by the world like the Russia-Ukraine war and the COVID-19 pandemic make it all the more important for India to become self-reliant. "In today's world, it is difficult to estimate when and what will happen and how it will affect us," PM Modi added. He also highlighted the importance of 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat'.

396.title: Roped in Alia as 'Sita' because we wanted a girl with inner strength: Rajamouli
396.article_body: Speaking about Alia's role as 'Sita' in RRR, filmmaker SS Rajamouli said it's not a full-fledged character but an important cameo. "We wanted a soft, fragile-looking girl but who also has enough inner strength...This is why I wanted Alia to do this role," he added. "The length of character [is] less but the importance of the character is...high," he said.

397.title: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee appears before ED in Delhi in coal scam case
397.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee was on Monday questioned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) at its Delhi office in connection with the coal scam case. Banerjee reached the central probe agency's office at around 11 am today. He was earlier questioned in this case in September. The ED has also summoned his wife, Rujira.

398.title: Plane carrying 133 passengers crashes in China, casualties unknown: Reports
398.article_body: A China Eastern Airlines aircraft carrying 133 passengers from Kunming to Guangzhou crashed in Guangxi on Monday, AFP and Reuters reported. The reports quoting Chinese media said that the number of casualties is unknown. Reuters reported that the plane, a Boeing 737 aircraft, had an "accident" in the region of Guangxi and caused a fire in the mountains.

399.title: 37 die after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar since Holi
399.article_body: About 37 people have died after allegedly consuming spurious liquor in Bihar's Bhagalpur, Banka and Madhepura since Holi, according to an official of state police. However, police claimed that they're "mysterious deaths" and probe is ongoing to determine the actual cause. Two persons died due to an ailment and heart attack respectively, as per their families, Bhagalpur District Magistrate said.

400.title: B'desh pacer Taskin Ahmed likely to join LSG as Mark Wood's replacement
400.article_body: LSG are likely to sign Bangladesh pacer Taskin Ahmed as Mark Wood's replacement for the upcoming IPL season. Wood, who was bought by LSG for ₹7.5 crore in the auction, was ruled out of the tournament after suffering an injury on his right elbow during the ongoing Test series between England and WI. Taskin has 23 wickets in 33 T20Is.

401.title: CBI arrests intelligence officer for taking ₹60 lakh bribe in Ghaziabad
401.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation has arrested a senior intelligence officer, Mohit Dhankar, for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹60 lakh. The incident came to light when a businessman complained to the CBI about an alleged demand of ₹1 crore by the officer in return for a favour to the businessman's father who has a case against him.

402.title: Couple from Mumbai booked for abetting their 35-yr-old maid's suicide
402.article_body: A couple from Mumbai's Bandra was booked for allegedly abetting the suicide of a 35-year-old woman, who was working as a maid at their home. The woman, who was debt-ridden, was promised a salary of ₹11,000 initially and ₹15,000 after she learned cooking. The woman reportedly became depressed after the accused, dissatisfied with her work, asked her to stop working.

403.title: Which countries have opened criminal cases against Russia over war crimes in Ukraine?
403.article_body: Ukraine's Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova has announced that six countries have already opened criminal cases in relation to Russian war crimes in Ukraine. They are Estonia, Lithuania, Germany, Poland, Slovakia and Sweden. "We'll work closely with them to facilitate exchange of information and evidence," she added. Russia started invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

404.title: Shocked by arrest, alleged torture of UP journalist: Editors Guild
404.article_body: Editors Guild of India (EGI) on Monday said that it's "shocked" by the manner in which a journalist based in Uttar Pradesh's Agra was arrested and allegedly tortured for reporting apparent malpractices in Assembly elections. It demanded Gaurav Bansal's immediate release and an independent court-monitored inquiry. Bansal's lawyer claimed that he was "tortured and humiliated" by police, EGI added.

405.title: Kaaranvir breaks down on 'Lock Upp' as he meets wife, daughters; video surfaces
405.article_body: Actor Kaaranvir Bohra, who is currently a contestant on the reality show 'Lock Upp', broke down when his wife Teejay Sidhu and daughters Bella, Vienna and Gia visited him on the show. In the video that was posted on his Instagram page, he can be seen crying while hugging his daughters. His youngest daughter can also be seen running around.

406.title: Now I'll sue all in UK, then see the fun: Lalit Modi on Bombay HC ruling in favour of him
406.article_body: After the Bombay High Court declared that the ₹425 crore Facilitation Fee in IPL broadcast rights case was legal and all parties, including BCCI, were aware of it, ex-IPL Chairman Lalit Modi said, "Today I feel vindicated as justice is delivered." "Now I will sue all in UK, then see the fun," he told Cricbuzz.
